creator: saleem@cordys.com
text:
Hi,

There is an issue with Apache Proxy Server with Alltheweb search results. I've 
been using Apache httpd 2.0.50 as a proxy server. When the search 
engine "alltheweb" is used, I get Yahoo forbidden page(You don't have 
permission to access SIG). Without Apache Proxy, the search engine results are 
fetched properly.

This is the case with all yahoo redirects( all the urls which use yahoo 
indexing).

Regards,
Saleem.

This sounds more like a configuration issue with your httpd configuration.
Please discuss on users mailing list first (users@httpd.apache.org). Feel free
to reopen this report if it turns out that there is a bug.
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text:
Hi,

I've the issue and have tested many times. I checked accessing "alltheweb" 
through anonymous proxy servers too.

I get the message the following message:

Sorry, Forbidden.
You don't have permission to access this URL on this server.

And the URL that is displayed in the address bar is :
http://av.rds.yahoo.com/_ylt=A9ibyKO5u1lE4wQBFB6BBqMX;_ylu=X3oDMTBybnZxaHNmBHBn
dANhdHdfd2ViX2hvbWUEc2VjA3NlYXJjaA--/SIG=11jnkb73g/EXP=1146817849/*-http%
3A//www.alltheweb.com/search?
cat=web&cs=utf8&q=apache&rys=0&itag=crv&_sb_lang=pref

which is a redirection to yahoo (probably yahoo index).
creator: saleem@cordys.com

text:
Have you discussed your problem on the users mailing list without success?
If yes, please post your proxy configuration here, if no please discuss it there.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
nick@webthing.com
text:
Almost certainly an instance of 41798.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 41798 ***

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
This is not in fact a duplicate of PR 41798.  Although the symptoms are the
same, the code path and therefore the fix are entirely different.

creator: nick@webthing.com
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 42592 ***
